intro: Peperomia quicheensis, commonly known as the Quiché peperomia, is a compact, low-growing plant native to Central America. It features glossy, heart-shaped leaves that are often variegated with shades of green, white, and silver. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in shades of white and green, which are typically borne on short, upright spikes. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Peperomia quicheensis is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its ornamental foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
